item.description:
Flood Fill

flood fill takes a texture input and treats every separated white section as an “island”, flood fill creates a series of random data for each of these islands in each of its RGBA channels.

Example: Flood fill individual channels: ![[FloodFillChannels-NoSide.gif]] This data can be used as masks for various blending modes, it can also be used as input for the following series of specialized flood fill nodes as detailed below
